notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.text: All information products included in https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics are provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to execute remote code through input injection, or allow an attacker to view the file structure of the affected device and access files that should be inaccessible.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Transportation Systems, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities, such as:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolating them from business networks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), recognizing VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most current version available. Also recognize VPN is only as secure as the connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploitation specifically targeting these vulnerabilities has been reported to CISA at this time.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

document.title: SAE IT-systems FW-50 Remote Telemetry Unit (RTU)

revision_history.summary: ICSA-20-126-02 SAE IT-systems FW-50 Remote Telemetry Unit (RTU)

product.name: FW-50 RTU 5 Series CPU-5B: Hardware Revision 2; CPLD Revision 6

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: The software does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input before it is placed in the output used as a webpage that is served to other users.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: SAE IT-systems recommends replacing the CPU card with a new one. Find a contact person for information regarding the replacement CPU card. After obtaining a replacement CPU card, program the card with the new version of setIT software. The upgrade can be downloaded from the SAE IT-systems website.
For information regarding the replacement CPU card, contact SAE IT-systems
SAE IT-systems recommends that users could also disable the web server port, since all referenced vulnerabilities are related to the web server.
SAE IT-systems also recommends if the project web server port is not used, disable the port for security reasons.
For information regarding disabling the project web server port contact the SAE IT-systems Hotline at: Phone: +49 221 / 59 808-55; Email: service@sae-it.de

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: A specially crafted request could allow an attacker to view the file structure of the affected device and access files that should be inaccessible.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: SAE IT-systems recommends replacing the CPU card with a new one. Find a contact person for information regarding the replacement CPU card. After obtaining a replacement CPU card, program the card with the new version of setIT software. The upgrade can be downloaded from the SAE IT-systems website.
For information regarding the replacement CPU card, contact SAE IT-systems
SAE IT-systems recommends that users could also disable the web server port, since all referenced vulnerabilities are related to the web server.
SAE IT-systems also recommends if the project web server port is not used, disable the port for security reasons.
For information regarding disabling the project web server port contact the SAE IT-systems Hotline at: Phone: +49 221 / 59 808-55; Email: service@sae-it.de
